channel.title: [SOLVED] What kind of pathfinding algorithm does rpsp/rs2 use?
channel.description:
Hello everyone,
Does anyone know what kind of pathfinding algorithm rsps' or rs2 use? I know about A* and Djikstra but is it one of them or a different one?
Thanks

item.title: [SOLVED] What kind of pathfinding algorithm does rpsp/rs2 use?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Parabot uses the djikstra algorithm for their pathfinding.

Read full topic
item.source: [SOLVED] What kind of pathfinding algorithm does rpsp/rs2 use?

item.title: [SOLVED] What kind of pathfinding algorithm does rpsp/rs2 use?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

A* is probably the best to use, but doesn’t mean it’s the most used. lol.

item.title: [SOLVED] What kind of pathfinding algorithm does rpsp/rs2 use?
item.dc:creator: @DefLegende DefLegende
item.description:
@DefLegende wrote:

Well I know the difference between djikstra and A* but I just wanted to know what was the most used pathfinding algorithm used in these kind of games or was it a custom one, etc…

Apperently it is A*

( http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,596444.0.html )

Read full topic
item.source: [SOLVED] What kind of pathfinding algorithm does rpsp/rs2 use?

item.title: [SOLVED] What kind of pathfinding algorithm does rpsp/rs2 use?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

A* search algorithm

In computer science, A* (pronounced as "A star") is a computer algorithm that is widely used in pathfinding and graph traversal, the process of plotting an efficiently directed path between multiple points, called "nodes". It enjoys widespread use due to its performance and accuracy. However, in practical travel-routing systems, it is generally outperformed by algorithms which can pre-process the graph to attain better performance, although other work has found A* to be superior to other appro Pe...

Read full topic
item.source: [SOLVED] What kind of pathfinding algorithm does rpsp/rs2 use?

item.title: [SOLVED] What kind of pathfinding algorithm does rpsp/rs2 use?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

I don’t understand the question, any rsps can use whatever pathfinding they want, it’s not necessarily A*(or any other).

  • A* and djisktra are practically the same thing, but differences in speed.

Read full topic
